page.title: 08Bramhope: Folk Customs
page.content: Bramhope has a Parish Council with 12 Councillors,all resident in Bramhope. They hold a monthly meeting at the Craven Institute,which is open to the public to attend.Elections for office take place every 4 years and all Bramhope residents over 18 years are eligible to vote.The Parish Council own and are responsible for 10 parts of the village.The Chairman wears a chain of office made of gold incorporating the White Rose of Yorkshire.The annual Bramhope Show is held at the Craven Institute,with competitions for a wide variety of activities.At the Remembrance Gardens in the village,an annual Sunday Service is held in November for the villagers killed in the 2 World Wars. This is arranged by the British Legion and is followed by a service in St. Giles Church or the Methodist Church.
